newsitem.title: KUWAIT: KUFPEC profit triples in '96 to $47.5 mln.
newsitem.headline: KUFPEC profit triples in '96 to $47.5 mln.

text.p: Kuwait Foreign Petroleum Exploration Company (KUFPEC) almost tripled its net profit in 1996 to 14.4 million dinars ($47.5 million), the firm's chairman was quoted on Tuesday as saying.
KUFPEC, a wholly-owned subsidiary of the state Kuwait Petroleum Corp (KPC), reported a profit of 4.9 million dinars in 1995 after a loss of 17 million dinars the previous year.

Chairman Mahmoud al-Rahmani told the official Kuwait News Agency (KUNA) that KUFPEC's revenue from the sale of crude and natural gas from its producing concessions around the world jumped by 72 percent in 1996 to $160 million.

KUFPEC was formed in 1981 to manage KPC's exploration operations outside Kuwait, mainly in the eastern hemisphere. It now has stakes in oil and gas producing areas including Egypt, Yemen, Indonesia, Australia, Tunisia and the South China Sea.
